definition: size (i.e. area) of a country, geographical region or school campus etc/(fig.) scope/extent

sentences.english: He also founded the vast Yuan Empire.
sentences.chinese: 他還建立了幅員遼闊的元大帝國呢。

sentences.english: China stretches across vast area covering the cold, temperate and tropical zones.
sentences.chinese: 中國幅員遼闊，包括了寒帶，溫帶和熱帶。

sentences.english: With 40 lakes which extend five kilometers along a valley, the spot covers an area of three square kilometers.
sentences.chinese: 四十個海子沿山谷綿亙五公里，幅員三平方公里。

sentences.english: Australia has a vast territory, rich in natural resources, economic and technological advanced.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亞幅員遼闊，資源豐富，經濟科技發達。

sentences.english: Our country is vast in territory, the history glorious multinational country.
sentences.chinese: 我國是一個幅員遼闊，歷史悠久的多民族國家。

sentences.english: Yingying is an antelope symbolizing the vastness of China's landscape.
sentences.chinese: 迎迎是一隻藏羚羊，象徵着中國的幅員遼闊。

sentences.english: Living in a country with plenty of space and a good climate.
sentences.chinese: 居住在一個幅員遼闊，氣候宜人的國家。

sentences.english: My mother and father are always going on vacation to some far-flung country.
sentences.chinese: 我父母總是去一些幅員廣闊的國家渡假。

definition: area (of a floor, piece of land etc)/surface area/tract of land
(separated only by) a narrow strip of water
Makung city in Penghu county 澎湖縣|澎湖县[Peng2 hu2 xian4] (Pescadores Islands), Taiwan
Wufeng township in Taichung county 臺中縣|台中县[Tai2 zhong1 xian4], Taiwan
no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
roads open in all directions (idiom); accessible from all sides
fault (geology)/CL:道[dao4],個|个[ge4]/(fig.) gap/rupture (in the transmission of some skill)/(tomography) cross-sectional
